info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA... SOUTHERN BEAVER...NORTHERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Calcutta, or near East Liverpool, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moon Township, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Monaca, Economy, Ambridge, Beaver, Calcutta, Baden, Sewickley, Ohioville, and Harmony Township. This includes Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 34 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
